problem:
The lines described by the equations
\[\bold{v} = \begin{pmatrix} 7 \\ -3 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix} + t \begin{pmatrix} -2 \\ 5 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix}\]and
\[\bold{w} = \begin{pmatrix} 8 \\ -1 \\ -1 \end{pmatrix} + u \begin{pmatrix} 1 \\ -4 \\ 0 \end{pmatrix}\]intersect at a point.  Find the point of intersection.
solution:
Setting the coordinates of $\bold{v}$ and $\bold{w}$ to be equal, we obtain the system of equations
\begin{align*}
7 - 2t &= 8 + u, \\
-3 + 5t &= -1 - 4u, \\
1 + t &= -1.
\end{align*}Solving for $t$ and $u$, we find $t = -2$ and $u = 3$.  Substituting into either of the equations given in the problem, we find that the point of intersection is
\[\boxed{\begin{pmatrix} 11 \\ -13 \\ -1 \end{pmatrix}}.\]
model_solution:
Step 1: Write the parametric equations for the intersection point.
\[\bold{v} = \begin{pmatrix} 7 \\ -3 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix} + t \begin{pmatrix} -2 \\ 5 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix}\]
\[\bold{w} = \begin{pmatrix} 8 \\ -1 \\ -1 \end{pmatrix} + u \begin{pmatrix} 1 \\ -4 \\ 0 \end{pmatrix}\]
\[x = 7 - 2 t\]
\[y = -3 + 5 t\]
\[z = 1 + t\]
\[x = 8 + u\]
\[y = -1 - 4 u\]
\[z = -1\]
Step 2:
\[\begin{array}{rcl} 7 - 2 t & = & 8 + u \\ -3 + 5 t & = & -1 - 4 u \\ 1 + t & = & -1 \end{array}\]
Step 3:
\[\begin{array}{rcl} 7 - 2 t & = & 8 + u \\ -2 t - u & = & 1 \ \ -3 + 5 t & = & -1 - 4 u \\ 5 t + 4 u & = & 4 \\ 1 + t & = & -1 \\ t & = & -2 \end{array}\]
Step 4:
\[\begin{array}{rcl} -2 t - u & = & 1 \\ 4 t & = & -1 \\ t & = & -\frac{1}{4} \\ 5 t + 4 u & = & 4 \\ 4 t + 16 u & = & 16 \\ u & = & \frac{4}{16} \\ u & = & \frac{1}{4} \end{array}\]
Step 5:
\[\begin{array}{rcl} x & = & 7 - 2 t \\ x & = & 7 - 2 \left(-2\right) \\ x & = & 9 \\ y & = & -3 + 5 t \\ y & = & -3 + 5 \left(-2\right) \\ y & = & -13 \\ z & = & 1 + t \\ z & = & 1 + \left(-2\right) \\ z & = & -1 \end{array}\]
Step 6:
\[\begin{array}{rcl} x & = & 7 - 2 \left(-2\right) \\ x & = & 9 \\ y & = & -3 + 5 \left(-2\right) \\ y & = & -13 \\ z & = & 1 + \left(-2\right) \\ z & = & -1 \\ \end{array}\]
\[\begin{array}{rcl} x & = & 7 - 2 \left(-2\right) \\ x & = & 7 + 4 \\ x & = & 11 \end{array}\]
Step 7:
\[\begin{array}{rcl} x & = & 7 - 2 t \\ x & = & 7 - 2 \left(-2\right) \\ x & = & 7 + 4 \\ x & = & 11 \\ y & = & -3 + 5 t \\ y & = & -3 + 5 \left(-2\right) \\ y & = & -13 \\ z & = & 1 + t \\ z & = & 1 + \left(-2\right) \\ z & = & -1 \\ \end{array}\]
Step 8:
\[\begin{array}{rcl} x & = & 7 - 2 t \\ x & = & 7 - 2 \left(-2\right) \\ x & = & 11 \\ y & = & -3 + 5 t \\ y & = & -3 + 5 \left(-2\right) \\ y & = & -13 \\ z & = & 1 + t \\ z & = & 1 + \left(-2\right) \\ z & = & -1 \\ \end{array}\]
\[\begin{array}{rcl} x & = & 7 - 2 t \\ x & = & 7 - 2 \left(-2\right) \\ x & = & 11 \\ y & = & -3 + 5 t \\ y & = & -3 + 5 t \\ z & = & 1 + t \\ z & = & 1 + t \\ \end{array}\]
\[\begin{array}{rcl} \left( 11 , -13 , -1 \right) \\ \end{array}\]
Final Answer: The final answer is $\boxed{\
